xxl.core.relational.cursors
Class Sampler

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.SecureDecoratorCursor<E>
      xxl.core.cursors.filters.Filter<E>
          xxl.core.cursors.filters.Sampler<Tuple>
              xxl.core.relational.cursors.Sampler
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Iterator<Tuple>, Cursor<Tuple>, MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>
public class Sampler
extends Sampler<Tuple>
implements MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>

The sampler is based on Sampler. A sampler is a filter that generates a sample of the elements contained in a given input iterator. To generate the sample, a pseudo random number generator and some parameters for the generation of random numbers can be passed to a constructor call. For a detailed description see Sampler.

The example in the main method wraps an enumeration (integers 0 to 99) to a metadata cursor using Cursors.wrapToMetaDataCursor(java.util.Iterator, Object). Then, a sample of approximately 10% of size is generated. The interesting call is: 

   cursor = new Sampler(cursor, 0.1);

protected CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object> globalMetaData

Constructor Detail

Sampler

public Sampler(MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>> cursor,
               double p,
               long seed)
Creates a new sampler based on a ContinuousRandomNumber cursor using Random as PRNG and a given Bernoulli probability.

Parameters:
cursor - the metadata cursor containing the elements the sample is to be created from.
p - the Bernoulli probability, i.e. the probability the elements will be contained in the delivered sample. p must be in range (0,1].
seed - the seed to the pseudo random number generator.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if p is not in range (0, 1].

Sampler

public Sampler(MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>> cursor,
               ContinuousRandomNumber crn,
               double p)
Creates a new sampler based on a ContinuousRandomNumber cursor and a given Bernoulli probability.

Parameters:
cursor - the metadata cursor containing the elements the sample is to be created from.
crn - a ContinuousRandomNumber cursor wrapping a PRNG.
p - the Bernoulli probability, i.e. the probability the elements will be contained in the delivered sample. p must be in range (0,1].
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if p is not in range (0, 1].

Sampler

public Sampler(java.sql.ResultSet resultSet,
               Function<? super java.sql.ResultSet,? extends Tuple> createInputTuple,
               double p,
               long seed)
Creates a new sampler based on a ContinuousRandomNumber cursor using Random as PRNG and a given Bernoulli probability.

Parameters:
resultSet - the input result set delivering the elements. The result set is wrapped internally to a metadata cursor using ResultSetMetaDataCursor.
createInputTuple - a function that maps a (row of the) result set to a tuple. The function gets a result set and maps the current row to a tuple. If null is passed, the factory method of ArrayTuple is used. It is forbidden to call the next, update and similar methods of the result set from inside the function!
p - the Bernoulli probability, i.e. the probability the elements will be contained in the delivered sample. p must be in range (0,1].
seed - the seed to the pseudo random number generator.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if p is not in range (0, 1].
